sanskrit_verse: झल्लो मल्लश्च राजन्याद्व्रात्यात्निच्छिविरेव च । व्रात्यात्लिच्छविरेव च नटश्च करणश्चैव खसो द्रविड एव च ॥ १०.२२॥
transliteration: jhallo mallas ca rājanyād vrātyāt nicchivireva ca | vrātyāt licchavireva ca naṭas ca karaṇas caiva khaso draviḍa eva ca || 10.22 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: From the Kshatriya who has fallen from duty arises the Malla; from the Vratya who departs from Dharma arises the Nishada; similarly from the Licchavi who abandons alignment arises the Natha, and from the degraded Karana arises the Khasa, even as from the corrupted Dravida arises the same.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with Dharma, not birth alone
Causation follows consciousness degradation through abandonment of Swadharma
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by inner alignment, not social role
Restoration logic requires reconnection to source Dharma, not external correction
Consciousness alignment determines societal expression and lawful participation
executable_legal_axioms: IF individual.abandonment_of_swadharma = TRUE THEN social_role.derived_authority = NULLIFIED
IF consciousness.alignment < THRESHOLD THEN legal_capacity = SUSPENDED AND restorative_pathway.ACTIVATED
IF societal_expression.deviates_from_dharma THEN automatic_reintegration.triggered UNTIL alignment.restored
IF birth_status ≠ active_dharma_adherence THEN exclusion_from_judicial_authority = ENFORCED
IF degradation_trail.detected IN lineage OR role THEN capacity_assessment.MANDATORY BEFORE legal_participation
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any judge or petitioner whose consciousness is found misaligned due to abandonment of Swadharma shall be automatically disqualified until completion of a prescribed reintegration process. The threshold of responsibility lies in sustained alignment, not procedural qualification.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that deviation originates in consciousness dislocation, not willful wrongdoing. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential departure from Dharma leads to diminished capacity. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of disconnection. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that correction occurs through restoration, not infliction.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Svadhyaya-based realignment program for consciousness reorientation
Assign completion process involving service to Dharma-aligned community
Implement mentorship under Dharma-adherent guide until capacity verified
Activate ritual purification protocols to restore energetic integrity
Reintroduce to legal framework only upon demonstrable consciousness stabilization
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone is the supreme adjudicator.
